Posts.Content: May 28, 2008 06:42AM Dragonfly-4 wrote: Thank You all so very much for your words of encouragement.  I have  a doctor's appointment with my regular doctor who is the care doctor here in our town and I am hoping to get some more information from him that I didn't get from the big city ocologist I saw Monday, in regards to all this.   It all has been so overwhelming and living in a small town there just isn't the support here that I need.  I am so thankful for all of you.  I am also meeting this afternoon with a social worker as we have three sons (21, 18 & 14 yrs)  and I need to know how to handle all of this with them, especially my already angry and hormonal 14 year old.  I turn 47 on the 10th and see the Oncologist in Winnipeg,the day before it.  It sure would be nice if she would have a lan by then.  Thanks so much for all your kind words and hugs.  My husband and I have appreciated them more than you will ever know. Dragonfly 9 I mnamed myself that as I love them)  My real name is Janene
Posts.Title: FRom A 11 to Iv in 30 seconds Dragonfly-4 Gitane

Posts.Content: Dragonfly-4 wrote: HI All, I have been reading these pages while anxiously awaiting the results from my bone scan and ct scan.  ct scan was good no spread inthe body.  But bone scan was so upsetting.  Skull mets and also possible in ribs.  The oncologist could give me no idea of what they are going       t o do for treatment for me.  She sent me away for two weeks so she can have a meeting with her colleages.  I am so frightened to say the very least.   I know no one who is in a similar situation who can help me through this.  I was hoping there was someone here that could hold my hand .  They had to do another test to see if I am Her2+ as it went missing in my pathology the oncologist nurse said.   I am estrogen positive but don't know the %.  I had 4 positive node, grade 2 , 3.2 tumour with clear margins.   Any kind words or help would be appreciated. Posts.Title: FRom A 11 to Iv in 30 seconds Dragonfly-4 Gitane

Posts.Content: May 29, 2008 10:51AM Dragonfly-4 wrote: Well I had my meeting with my local Doctor who is also my cancer Doctor ( not my onc). But he had my my complete results and  I am not Estrogen + as I was told by my Onc as my rating  1/ 8, but I am Progestron + 8/8!  I am also Her2 + (3)!   Does anyone know what kind of treatment I will be getting?  Do they even treat Pogestron+ and if so with what?  We are waiting until our next meeting with my Ocn June 9th and then we plan on telling the kids.  I just kinda want to know what the Ocn plans.  I'm feeling a little better but still pretty upset about ev everything.
Posts.Title: FRom A 11 to Iv in 30 seconds Dragonfly-4 Gitane

Posts.Content: May 30, 2008 11:44AM Dragonfly-4 wrote: Thank You all for your well wishes and support.  Its great feeling I am not alone.  I caught onto something yesterday and they are now checking through all my pathology reports as my first biopsy done on the tumor prior to surgery said i was er+ , my Onc said I was Er+ but when my local doctor looked at final pathology report and went over it with me extensively on Wednesday it said I was Er-.  So I phoned the Ocn's office and told her that there was a discrepancy somewhere.  Are mistakes like this made often?  Can they now go back and figure out the estrogen status ?  Can they do it with a blood test?  My Ocn is away until mid next week so I am feeling in limbo.  I phoned my regular docotr and he was very upset about it.  I surew hope they get this straightened out so they can get me on the right medicine if needed! Janene
Posts.Title: FRom A 11 to Iv in 30 seconds Dragonfly-4 Gitane

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2008 01:26AM Dragonfly-4 wrote: I am starting herceptin next week and have been told I will be on it as long as it keeps working and that I can tolerate it.  LuAnnH is right early bc are on it for one year.  Where I live in Canada if you are taken off it after a year and need to go back on it the provincial  government will not cover the cost. I have been told it cost $40,000. a year to be on.
Posts.Title: HER2 + Gals - a Question mthomp2020 mthomp2020

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2008 10:56AM Dragonfly-4 wrote: Hi River, I totally understand where you are coming from as I have been diagnosed with breast cancer a couple of months ago and now have bone mets.  My ocn told me 2 years.  My cancer doctor told me 5 years.  I am determined to prove them both wrong.  I have yet to receive any treatment.  In fact it been 7 wks since my mastectomy.  I see my ocn on Monday ( she lives in a bigger city) I hope she has a plan in place as I am getting impatient to say the least.  I am premenopausal and was wondering what treatment- drugs others have had that were effective. My cancer doctor said something about pamidronate. River, I felt so deflated with the news but with the help of friends and people on this website I am determined to battle hard.  It took a lot to find the fight in myself.  I pray you find it too! Hugs, Dragonfly
